title: Behind the Veil of the ‘Free’ Covid Test
sub_head: You don’t have to be an expert to know that something about this stinks.
body:
The day before Cameron Kaplan’s op-ed “The High Cost of ‘Free’ Covid Testing” (Feb. 4) was published, I received a $5,025 “summary of claim for services” from my health-insurance provider. It included a $975 charge for a physician and five separate laboratory charges. Our insurance company paid about $1,200 and our uncovered liability was $655, for which we have not yet been billed. We had no idea what the bill was about.
We found the doctor named in the bill online, and he owns an urgent-care clinic near us. My wife needed a rapid PCR test in October, and paid $95 to get tested at the doctor’s clinic. How did a routine Covid test result in a $5,000 bill? And why did our insurance company agree to pay $1,200 for it? Can you imagine the scale at which this is happening nationwide? You don’t have to be an expert to know that something about this stinks.
